image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Georgia; born in Atlanta, Fulton County, Ga., May 14, 1946; graduated from Athens High School, Athens, Ga., 1963; United States Marine Corps Reserve, 1964-1967; B.S., University of Georgia, Athens, Ga., 1967; M.D., Medical College of Georgia, Augusta, Ga., 1971; physician; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Tenth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative Charles Norwood, and to the three succeeding Congresses (July 17, 2007-January 3, 2015); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in 2014, but was an unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States Senate; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Seventeenth Congress in 2020; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Eighteenth Congress in 2022.

researchRecord.name: The papers of Congressman Paul Broun, Jr. have not yet been processed.

recordLocation.name: Richard B. Russell Library for Political Research and Studies
